errorResponses.reason: is returned if all documents could be imported successfully.
is returned if type contains an invalid value, no collection is specified, the documents are incorrectly encoded, or the request is malformed.
is returned if collection or the _from or _to attributes of an imported edge refer to an unknown collection.
is returned if the import would trigger a unique key violation and complete is set to true.
is returned if the server cannot auto-generate a document key (out of keys error) for a document with no user-defined key.

parameters.name: documents
parameters.description: The body must either be a JSON-encoded list of documents or a string with multiple JSON documents separated by newlines.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Determines how the body of the request will be interpreted. type can have the following values:

parameters.name: createCollection
parameters.description: If this parameter has a value of true or yes, then the collection is created if it does not yet exist. Other values will be ignored so the collection must be present for the operation to succeed.

parameters.name: waitForSync
parameters.description: Wait until documents have been synced to disk before returning.

parameters.name: complete
parameters.description: If set to true or yes, it will make the whole import fail if any error occurs. Otherwise the import will continue even if some documents cannot be imported.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: If set to true or yes, the result will include an attribute details with details about documents that could not be imported.

operations.notes:
Creates documents in the collection identified by collection-name. The JSON representations of the documents must be passed as the body of the POST request. The request body can either consist of multiple lines, with each line being a single stand-alone JSON document, or a JSON list.

The response is a JSON object with the following attributes:

- created: number of documents imported.

- errors: number of documents that were not imported due to an error.

- empty: number of empty lines found in the input (will only contain a value greater zero for types documents or auto).

- details: if URL parameter details is set to true, the result will contain a details attribute which is a list with more detailed information about which documents could not be inserted.
operations.examples:
Importing documents with heterogenous attributes from a JSON list: 

unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/import?collection=products&type=list
[{"_key":"abc","value1":25,"value2":"test","allowed":true},{"_key":"foo","name":"baz"},{"name":{"detailed":"detailed name","short":"short name"}}]

HTTP/1.1 201 Created
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : false, 
  "created" : 3, 
  "errors" : 0, 
  "empty" : 0 
}

Importing documents from individual JSON lines: 

unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/import?collection=products&type=documents
{ "_key": "abc", "value1": 25, "value2": "test", "allowed": true }
{ "_key": "foo", "name": "baz" }

{ "name": { "detailed": "detailed name", "short": "short name" } }


HTTP/1.1 201 Created
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : false, 
  "created" : 3, 
  "errors" : 0, 
  "empty" : 1 
}

Using the auto type detection: 

unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/import?collection=products&type=auto
[{"_key":"abc","value1":25,"value2":"test","allowed":true},{"_key":"foo","name":"baz"},{"name":{"detailed":"detailed name","short":"short name"}}]

HTTP/1.1 201 Created
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : false, 
  "created" : 3, 
  "errors" : 0, 
  "empty" : 0 
}

Importing documents into a new collection from a JSON list: 

unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/import?collection=products&createCollection=true&type=list
[{"id":"12553","active":true},{"id":"4433","active":false},{"id":"55932","count":4334}]

HTTP/1.1 201 Created
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : false, 
  "created" : 3, 
  "errors" : 0, 
  "empty" : 0 
}

Importing into an edge collection, with attributes _from, _to and name: 

unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/import?collection=links&type=documents
{ "_from": "products/123", "_to": "products/234" }
{ "_from": "products/332", "_to": "products/abc", "name": "other name" }

HTTP/1.1 201 Created
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : false, 
  "created" : 2, 
  "errors" : 0, 
  "empty" : 0 
}

Importing into an edge collection, omitting _from or _to: 

unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/import?collection=links&type=list&details=true
[{"name":"some name"}]

HTTP/1.1 201 Created
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : false, 
  "created" : 0, 
  "errors" : 1, 
  "empty" : 0, 
  "details" : [ 
    "at position 1: missing '_from' or '_to' attribute" 
  ] 
}

Violating a unique constraint, but allow partial imports: 

unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/import?collection=products&type=documents&details=true
{ "_key": "abc", "value1": 25, "value2": "test" }
{ "_key": "abc", "value1": "bar", "value2": "baz" }

HTTP/1.1 201 Created
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : false, 
  "created" : 1, 
  "errors" : 1, 
  "empty" : 0, 
  "details" : [ 
    "at position 2: creating document failed with error 'unique constraint violated',..." 
  ] 
}

Violating a unique constraint, not allowing partial imports: 

unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/import?collection=products&type=documents&complete=true
{ "_key": "abc", "value1": 25, "value2": "test" }
{ "_key": "abc", "value1": "bar", "value2": "baz" }

HTTP/1.1 409 Conflict
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : true, 
  "errorMessage" : "cannot create document, unique constraint violated", 
  "code" : 409, 
  "errorNum" : 1210 
}

Using a non-existing collection: 

unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/import?collection=products&type=documents
{ "name": "test" }

HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : true, 
  "errorMessage" : "collection 'products' not found", 
  "code" : 404, 
  "errorNum" : 1203 
}

Using a malformed body: 

unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/import?collection=products&type=list
{ }

HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : true, 
  "errorMessage" : "expecting a JSON list in the request", 
  "code" : 400, 
  "errorNum" : 400 
}

errorResponses.reason: is returned if all documents could be imported successfully.
is returned if type contains an invalid value, no collection is specified, the documents are incorrectly encoded, or the request is malformed.
is returned if collection or the _from or _to attributes of an imported edge refer to an unknown collection.
is returned if the import would trigger a unique key violation and complete is set to true.
is returned if the server cannot auto-generate a document key (out of keys error) for a document with no user-defined key.

parameters.name: documents
parameters.description: The body must consist of JSON-encoded lists of attribute values, with one  line per per document. The first line of the request must be a JSON-encoded  list of attribute names.

parameters.name: createCollection
parameters.description: If this parameter has a value of true or yes, then the collection is created if it does not yet exist. Other values will be ignored so the collection must be present for the operation to succeed.

parameters.name: waitForSync
parameters.description: Wait until documents have been synced to disk before returning.

parameters.name: complete
parameters.description: If set to true or yes, it will make the whole import fail if any error occurs. Otherwise the import will continue even if some documents cannot be imported.

parameters.name: details
parameters.description: If set to true or yes, the result will include an attribute details with details about documents that could not be imported.

operations.notes:
Creates documents in the collection identified by collection-name. The first line of the request body must contain a JSON-encoded list of attribute names. All following lines in the request body must contain JSON-encoded lists of attribute values. Each line is interpreted as a separate document, and the values specified will be mapped to the list of attribute names specified in the first header line.

The response is a JSON object with the following attributes:

- created: number of documents imported.

- errors: number of documents that were not imported due to an error.

- empty: number of empty lines found in the input (will only contain a value greater zero for types documents or auto).

- details: if URL parameter details is set to true, the result will contain a details attribute which is a list with more detailed information about which documents could not be inserted.
operations.examples:
Importing two documents, with attributes _key, value1 and value2 each. One line in the import data is empty: 

unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/import?collection=products
[ "_key", "value1", "value2" ]
[ "abc", 25, "test" ]

[ "foo", "bar", "baz" ]

HTTP/1.1 201 Created
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : false, 
  "created" : 2, 
  "errors" : 0, 
  "empty" : 1 
}

Importing two documents into a new collection: 

unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/import?collection=products&createCollection=true
[ "value1", "value2" ]
[ 1234, null ]
[ "foo", "bar" ]
[ 534.55, true ]

HTTP/1.1 201 Created
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : false, 
  "created" : 3, 
  "errors" : 0, 
  "empty" : 0 
}

Importing into an edge collection, with attributes _from, _to and name: 

unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/import?collection=links
[ "_from", "_to", "name" ]
[ "products/123", "products/234", "some name" ]
[ "products/332", "products/abc", "other name" ]

HTTP/1.1 201 Created
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : false, 
  "created" : 2, 
  "errors" : 0, 
  "empty" : 0 
}

Importing into an edge collection, omitting _from or _to: 

unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/import?collection=links&details=true
[ "name" ]
[ "some name" ]
[ "other name" ]

HTTP/1.1 201 Created
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : false, 
  "created" : 0, 
  "errors" : 2, 
  "empty" : 0, 
  "details" : [ 
    "at position 1: missing '_from' or '_to' attribute", 
    "at position 2: missing '_from' or '_to' attribute" 
  ] 
}

Violating a unique constraint, but allow partial imports: 

unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/import?collection=products&details=true
[ "_key", "value1", "value2" ]
[ "abc", 25, "test" ]
[ "abc", "bar", "baz" ]

HTTP/1.1 201 Created
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : false, 
  "created" : 1, 
  "errors" : 1, 
  "empty" : 0, 
  "details" : [ 
    "at position 2: creating document failed with error 'unique constraint violated',..." 
  ] 
}

Violating a unique constraint, not allowing partial imports: 

unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/import?collection=products&complete=true
[ "_key", "value1", "value2" ]
[ "abc", 25, "test" ]
[ "abc", "bar", "baz" ]

HTTP/1.1 409 Conflict
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : true, 
  "errorMessage" : "cannot create document, unique constraint violated", 
  "code" : 409, 
  "errorNum" : 1210 
}

Using a non-existing collection: 

unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/import?collection=products
[ "_key", "value1", "value2" ]
[ "abc", 25, "test" ]
[ "foo", "bar", "baz" ]

HTTP/1.1 404 Not Found
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : true, 
  "errorMessage" : "collection 'products' not found", 
  "code" : 404, 
  "errorNum" : 1203 
}

Using a malformed body: 

unix> curl -X POST --data @- --dump - http://localhost:8529/_api/import?collection=products
{ "_key": "foo", "value1": "bar" }

HTTP/1.1 400 Bad Request
content-type: application/json; charset=utf-8

{ 
  "error" : true, 
  "errorMessage" : "no JSON list found in second line", 
  "code" : 400, 
  "errorNum" : 400 
}
